member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.AddPackageReferenceToProjectCommand
member.summary: Represents a command to add a package reference to a .NET project file.
member.remarks: This command utilizes a shell executor to execute the necessary `dotnet` CLI commands to add a package reference to the specified project. It supports specifying an optional package version and can handle pre-release packages.
member.param: The shell executor used to execute the command.
The target .NET project to which the package reference will be added.
The name of the package to add as a reference.

The name of the package to add as a reference.

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.AddProjectReferenceToProjectCommand
member.summary: Represents a command that adds a project reference to a target .NET project using the dotnet CLI.
member.remarks: This command automates the process of adding a project reference by invoking the 'dotnet add reference' command. It is typically used in build automation or tooling scenarios to programmatically manage project dependencies.
member.param: The shell executor used to run the underlying dotnet CLI command.
The target .NET project to which the reference will be added. Cannot be null.
The .NET project to add as a reference to the target project. Cannot be null.

The target .NET project to which the reference will be added. Cannot be null.
The .NET project to add as a reference to the target project. Cannot be null.

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.Constants.SupportedFrameworkName
member.summary: Represents a supported .NET or .NET Standard framework name as a strongly typed value.
member.remarks: Use the predefined static fields, such as , , , , and , to refer to specific supported framework versions. This type provides type safety and avoids errors associated with using raw string literals for framework names.

member.name: F:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.Constants.SupportedFrameworkName.All
member.summary: Gets a read-only dictionary containing all supported framework names mapped to their corresponding instances.
member.remarks: The dictionary keys are string representations of supported frameworks, and the values are the associated objects. This collection can be used to enumerate or look up supported frameworks by name.

members.member:
Converts the string representation of the name of one of the constants to an equivalent object. The return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded. The case-sensitive string representation of the SupportedFrameworkName name or underlying value to convert. When this method returns, contains an object of type SupportedFrameworkName whose value is represented by if the parse operation succeeds. If the parse operation fails, contains the default value of the underlying type of TEnum. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
is . /// if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, .

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.Constants.SupportedProjectTemplateName
member.summary: Represents a supported project template name used to identify and work with predefined project templates.
member.remarks: This type provides named instances for each supported project template, such as xUnit, Console, or Blazor. It enables type-safe handling of project template names and supports conversion to and from their string representations. Use the static members to access specific templates or enumerate all supported templates via the All property.

member.name: F:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.Constants.SupportedProjectTemplateName.All
member.summary: Provides a read-only dictionary containing all supported project template names, keyed by their string identifiers.
member.remarks: The dictionary maps each template's string name to its corresponding instance. This collection can be used to enumerate or look up all available project templates by name.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.Constants.SupportedProjectTemplateName.op_Implicit(Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.Constants.SupportedProjectTemplateName)~System.String
member.summary: Converts a SupportedProjectTemplateName instance to its string representation.
member.remarks: This operator enables implicit conversion of a SupportedProjectTemplateName to a string, allowing instances to be used wherever a string is expected. The conversion returns the underlying name value of the SupportedProjectTemplateName.
member.param: The SupportedProjectTemplateName instance to convert.

members.member:
Converts the string representation of the name of one of the constants to an equivalent object. The return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded. The case-sensitive string representation of the SupportedProjectTemplateName name or underlying value to convert. When this method returns, contains an object of type SupportedProjectTemplateName whose value is represented by if the parse operation succeeds. If the parse operation fails, contains the default value of the underlying type of TEnum. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
is . /// if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, .

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.CreateClassLibProjectCommand
member.summary: Represents a command that creates a new .NET class library project using the specified parameters.
member.remarks: This command automates the creation of a .NET class library project by invoking the appropriate 'dotnet new classlib' command. After project creation, it attempts to remove the default 'Class1.cs' file if it exists. This class is typically used in build automation or tooling scenarios where programmatic project creation is required.
member.param: The shell executor used to run the project creation command.
The directory in which to create the new class library project. If empty or null, the current directory is used.
The name to assign to the new project. If empty or null, the default project name is used.
The target framework for the new class library project.
An optional file system abstraction used for file operations. If null, the default file system is used.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.CreateClassLibProjectCommand.#ctor(Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.IShellExecutor,System.String,System.String,Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.Constants.SupportedFrameworkName,Pri.Essentials.Abstractions.IFileSystem)
member.summary: Represents a command that creates a new .NET class library project using the specified parameters.
member.remarks: This command automates the creation of a .NET class library project by invoking the appropriate 'dotnet new classlib' command. After project creation, it attempts to remove the default 'Class1.cs' file if it exists. This class is typically used in build automation or tooling scenarios where programmatic project creation is required.
member.param: The shell executor used to run the project creation command.
The directory in which to create the new class library project. If empty or null, the current directory is used.
The name to assign to the new project. If empty or null, the default project name is used.
The target framework for the new class library project.
An optional file system abstraction used for file operations. If null, the default file system is used.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.CreateClassLibProjectCommand.TryDelete(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to delete the file at the specified path, ignoring any I/O errors that occur during deletion.
member.remarks: This wraps the untestable paranoid try/catch so that it can be ignored with ExcludeFromCodeCoverageAttribute
member.param: The path of the file to delete. Cannot be null or empty.

member.remarks: This command is responsible for generating a .NET project file in the specified output directory with the provided name, using the given project template and framework.

The name of the project template to use for creating the .NET project.
The directory where the new project will be created.

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Commands.ProjectCommandBase
member.summary: Provides a base class for project-related command implementations that generate output files for a specific framework.
member.remarks: This class is intended to be inherited by commands that operate on project files and produce output for a specified framework. Derived classes must implement the BuildCommandLine method to define the specific command-line arguments required for execution.
member.param: The shell executor used to run external commands required by the project command.
The directory where the output file will be created. Cannot be null or empty.
The name of the output file to generate. Cannot be null or empty.
The target framework for which the command is executed.

The directory where the output file will be created. Cannot be null or empty.
The name of the output file to generate. Cannot be null or empty.
The target framework for which the command is executed.

member.summary: The name of the solution (filename). The parameter to the dotnet new sln --name option

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.DotnetProject
member.summary: An encapsulation of a .NET .csproj file and the actions available via `dotnet sln`
member.remarks: We don't have methods on this type to add files or references because if methods on this type are called from PowerShell, the context is not known, and we won't know the real current directory.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.DotnetProject.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DotnetProject class with the specified project directory and name.
member.param: The path to the project directory. Can be null to use the current directory.
The name of the project. Can be null if the project name should be inferred.

member.name: P:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.DotnetProject.Solution
member.summary: Gets or sets the .NET solution associated with this instance.
member.remarks: The original intention was to be able to use this given a piped project to perform commands on the solution, but cannot have multiple pipeline inputs in a cmdlet, so this might be extraneous.

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.DotnetSolution
member.summary: An encapsulation of a .NET .sln file and the actions available via `dotnet sln`
member.remarks: We don't have methods on this type to create or add projects because if methods on this type are called from PowerShell, the context is not known, and we won't know the real current directory.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.DotnetSolution.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DotnetSolution class with the specified directory and solution name.
member.param: The path to the directory containing the solution. Can be null to use the current directory.
The name of the solution. Can be null to use a default or inferred name.

member.name: P:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.DotnetSolution.FullPath
member.summary: Gets the full file system path to the solution file, including the ".sln" extension.

member.summary: A proxy to the Linux shell

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.ProjectTemplateNameMapping
member.summary: Provides a mapping between supported project template names and factory functions that create the corresponding project command instances.
member.remarks: This class is intended to centralize the association of project template types with their respective command creation logic. It enables consumers to retrieve a command factory for a given template, facilitating consistent project creation workflows. The class is static and cannot be instantiated.

member.name: F:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.ProjectTemplateNameMapping.CommandMap
member.summary: A dictionary mapping supported project template names to factory functions that create the corresponding

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Result
member.summary: Represents the result of an operation, indicating whether it was successful or not.

member.name: P:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.Result.IsSuccessful
member.summary: Indicates whether the operation was successful.

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.ShellOperationResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a shell command execution, including the exit code, standard output, and standard error output.
member.remarks: Use this record to capture and inspect the outcome of executing a shell or command-line process. The properties provide access to the process's exit code and any output or error messages generated during execution.
member.param: The exit code returned by the shell process. A value of 0 typically indicates success; nonzero values indicate an error or abnormal termination.
The text written to the standard output stream by the shell command. May be empty if the command produced no output.
The text written to the standard error stream by the shell command. May be empty if no errors were reported.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.ShellOperationResult.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Represents the result of a shell command execution, including the exit code, standard output, and standard error output.
member.remarks: Use this record to capture and inspect the outcome of executing a shell or command-line process. The properties provide access to the process's exit code and any output or error messages generated during execution.
member.param: The exit code returned by the shell process. A value of 0 typically indicates success; nonzero values indicate an error or abnormal termination.
The text written to the standard output stream by the shell command. May be empty if the command produced no output.
The text written to the standard error stream by the shell command. May be empty if no errors were reported.

member.name: P:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.ShellOperationResult.ExitCode
member.summary: Gets the exit code returned by the process after it has terminated.

member.name: P:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.ShellOperationResult.OutputText
member.summary: Gets the output text generated by the operation.

member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.VisualStudioProjectConfigurationService
member.summary: Provides services for configuring Visual Studio project files.
member.remarks: This service assumes that options are applied unconditionally in the project file; that is, they are applied to a singe unattributed ProgramGroup element in the root (<Project>) element.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.VisualStudioProjectConfigurationService.SetRestorePackagesWithLockFile(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the RestorePackagesWithLockFile property if it doesn't exist, and sets it to true

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.VisualStudioProjectConfigurationService.EnableRestorePackagesWithLockFile(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Adds the RestorePackagesWithLockFile property if it doesn't exist, and sets it to true
member.param: The stream representing the project file to update. The stream must be writable and positioned at the start of the project file content.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.DotnetProjects.VisualStudioProjectConfigurationService.EnableGenerateDocumentationFile(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Enables the generation of XML documentation file output for the specified project file stream.
member.param: The stream representing the project file to update. The stream must be writable and positioned at the start of the project file content.
